meanings.definition: Appear as a shadowy form, especially one that is large or threatening.
meanings.sent1: The dark figure was looming in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds were looming on the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The looming shadow turned out to be just a tree.
meanings.sent4: The mountain loomed over the tiny village like a giant.
meanings.sent5: The looming presence of the teacher made the students nervous.

meanings.definition: Be imminent or about to happen.
meanings.sent1: The deadline is looming closer and closer.
meanings.sent2: The exam is looming at the end of the week.
meanings.sent3: The looming party is causing excitement among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The decision loomed over him, creating anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The looming threat of rain made them hurry home.

meanings.sent1: The tower loomed above the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The cliff loomed over the crashing waves below.
meanings.sent3: The looming branch almost hit him on the head.
meanings.sent4: The ship loomed out of the fog like a ghostly apparition.
meanings.sent5: The looming rock formation stood out against the clear sky.
